result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas A. Laschiava was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas A. Laschiava is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas A. Laschiava was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:50 am - Defendant Thomas A. Laschiava in court with attorney Mary M. Hogan.  Defendant Thomas A. Laschiava in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf140 and 14tr1954.  State moves to dismiss Count 2 in case 14cf140 and 14tr1954 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1 in Case 14cf140.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Hogan/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence - Concurrent with any other sentence currently pending
Imposed and Stayed WSP 5 yrs - 2 1/2 yrs Initial Confinement, 2 1/2 yrs Extended Supervision
Probation 3 yrs
Jail 1 year - May serve in Outagamie County - 55 days jail credit - W/Huber for all purposes
Fine $2250
DNA Surcharge $250
IID Surcharge $50
DL revocation 3 yrs
IID 3 yrs
Alcohol Assessment/Driver Safety Plan
Absolute Sobriety
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights, NADVI
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:10 pm - Defendant Thomas A. Laschiava in court with attorney Mary M. Hogan.  Defendant Thomas A. Laschiava in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14tr1954.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Information filed.  Hogan - In receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty please.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Thomas A. Laschiava in court with attorney Mary M. Hogan.  Defendant Thomas A. Laschiava in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:14
In receipt, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - gives statement regarding bail - Bednar Clemens statement - Court continues bail as set  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
